data.title: Drummer Jon Card (D.O.A., the Subhumans, SNFU, Personality Crisis) Dead at 63 │ Exclaim!
data.meta_description: D.O.A. shared the news on social media
data.meta_site_name: Drummer Jon Card (D.O.A., the Subhumans, SNFU, Personality Crisis) Dead at 63 │ Exclaim!
data.text:
Jon Card — who drummed in Canadian punk and hardcore bands D.O.A., the Subhumans, SNFU and Personality Crisis — has died. He was 63.

No cause of death has been reported at this time. The news was shared by D.O.A. on social media, the band revealing that Card had died yesterday (April 8). "RIP old friend," they wrote.

Card was born in Zweibrücken, Germany, while his father was stationed in the Royal Canadian Air Force. The drummer spent the majority of his youth in Calgary, and founded the band Plasticide there in his teenage years. He eventually joined cult-favourite Winnipeg band Personality Crisis and played on their 1983 album, Creatures for Awhile.
